thread.title: Trump Welcomes Schumer To Bipartisan White House Reception
thread.title_full: Trump Welcomes Schumer To Bipartisan White House Reception

author: Randy DeSoto
title: Trump Welcomes Schumer To Bipartisan White House Reception
text:
Trump Welcomes Schumer To Bipartisan White House Reception "Nobody ever told me that politics was going to be so much fun." by Randy DeSoto March 29, 2017 at 9:36am Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print   
President Donald Trump expressed confidence that a bipartisan deal could be done on healthcare at a reception at the White House for senators and their spouses Tuesday night. 
“I have some special friends in this room. … Here we are, and shockingly, it’s bipartisan,” Trump said. “A lot of people showed up. People we weren’t expecting. I know that we are all going to make a deal on healthcare. That’s such an easy one. I have no doubt that that’s going to happen very quickly. We have all been promising it — Democrat, Republican — to the public.” 
Those in attendance in the East Room event included Sens. Ted Cruz, R-Texas, and Rand Paul, R-Ky., who were critics of the House Republican healthcare proposal, as well as Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer, D-N.Y.   O’Reilly Apologizes After Making ‘Dumb’ Comment About Democratic Lawmaker’s Appearance 
In all, the White House listed 56 senators as attendees, and among them were 16 Democrats and one Independent. 
Trump specifically noted Schumer’s presence saying, “I think we are going to have some very good relationships — right, Chuck? I see Chuck. Hello, Chuck.” "Nobody ever told me that politics was going to be so much fun." @POTUS spoke at a bipartisan @WhiteHouse reception for Senators & spouses. pic.twitter.com/2dEr2XZbHg 
— Fox News (@FoxNews) March 28, 2017   
Schumer, of course, has been a constant critic of the Trump administration, including most recently his statement indicating he will filibuster the president’s Supreme Court nominee Judge Neil Gorsuch and his opposition to the Republican healthcare plan. Trump breaks silence with Schumer at White House reception: "Hello, Chuck" https://t.co/DwFrZMjrTK pic.twitter.com/Jpu15EipOS 
— New York Daily News (@NYDailyNews) March 29, 2017 
Trump appeared to be taking the partisan hits in stride saying, “Nobody ever told me that politics was going to be so much fun.” 
“We are going to be doing a great job. Hopefully it will start being bipartisan because everybody really wants the same thing,” he said. “We want greatness for this country that we love.”
